columns.text: In this problem, we will determine which of the two options will be better for the company based on their equivalent annual costs.

The equivalent annual cost is a method of comparing two mutually exclusive projects that have different lifespans. It represents how much each project costs the firm annually throughout the lifespan of the asset.

For this problem, we will compare which option is better if the company needs to regularly change the conveyor belt system. 

Based on the computations in the previous problem, the net present value of **System A** is $-\$502,090.55$ while that of **System B** is $-\$560,305.01$.

When comparing the equivalent annual cost of two projects/assets, the higher value represents the better choice. In this case, the more positive value should be chosen.

For **System A** which has a discount rate of $8\%$ and a lifespan of $4$ years, the annuity factor is $3.3121$ while for **System B** with the same discount rate but a lifespan of $6$ years, the annuity factor will be $4.6229$

Substituting the values, we will get the equivalent annual cost for each system.

For **System A**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equivalent annual cost}&=\dfrac{-\$502,090.55}{3.3121}\\[15 pt]
&=-\$151,592.81
\end{aligned}$$

The equivalent annual cost for **System A** is $-\$151,592.81$

For **System B**:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equivalent annual cost}&=\dfrac{-\$560,305.01}{4.6229}\\[15 pt]
&=-\$121,202.06
\end{aligned}$$

The equivalent annual cost for **System B** is $-\$121,202.06$

Based on the computed values, the best option is **System B** since it is more positive than the other option. This means that it has a lower annual cost compared to System A which is beneficial since the company needs to replace the system often.
